issues.description: Documentation states 'Default: 1' but code implements default value of 3
issues.reproduction_result: A new developer would set up the service expecting default retryCount=1, but the actual default is 3. This causes unexpected behavior.
issues.fix_explanation: Change 'Default: 1' to 'Default: 3' to match the code: const retryCount = config.retryCount ?? 3;

issues.description: Documentation states 'Range: 0–10' but code validates against range 1-5
issues.reproduction_result: Following the documented range, a developer could set retryCount=0 or retryCount=10, both of which would throw an error: 'retryCount must be between 1 and 5'
issues.fix_explanation: Change 'Range: 0–10' to 'Range: 1–5' to match the validation in input.ts: if (retryCount < 1 || retryCount > 5)

issues.description: Example shows startService({ retryCount: 0 }) but value 0 is outside the valid range
issues.reproduction_result: Running the documented example throws error: 'retryCount must be between 1 and 5'
issues.fix_explanation: Replace example 'startService({ retryCount: 0 })' with 'startService({ retryCount: 2 })' to use a valid value within the range 1-5
